poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Oh Wattie! Tango wabster wove And thirsty tongue to palate clove. The wabster wove, the preacher practised, A warld birrelled on its axis. Unravel, dehisce and decline. Is there a second chance? Ask Scotty. The keel was a shuttle on no loom. Slack, dehiscent foam. Knots and frames, Knots and frames, and nothing Wove its overmastering ephemera.
